item.title: Understanding and Configuring System Logging
item.description: Understanding System Logging Services on a Linux server write information to log files in different destinations using different approaches, and there are multiple ways to find relevant information in those log files. Services can write log information via: Direct Write - information is written directly to a log file by a service. rsyslogd - a service passes log information to the rsyslogd service that in turn takes care of managing centralized log files.
